alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 30 at 3:08PM PDT until May 30 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Mountain burn scar in... Central Siskiyou County in northern California... * Until 400 PM PDT. * At 308 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Mountain Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Mountain Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Large debris may be dislodged onto Gazelle Callahan Road impacting travel and endangering human life. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Avoid Gazelle Callahan Road during heavy rainfall. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
